AEo.caption: Show page number? (counter)
AEo.doc: Check this box to have you pages numerated in the footer. Below you can tell what pages you want the number to not show, for example you want the first page (possibly a cover) to not show the number one.
AEo.name: show_page_number

AEp.caption: Counter alignment
AEp.doc: How you want the number to be aligned. Note that other elements in the footer may influence this number's position, so it may not show where you expect alignment wise. "Testing" is your friend. Protip: If you use center and insert other elements in the footer, make sure you're using an even (2, 4, 6 etc...) number of elements so the page count number will fall right in the middle of the elements.
AEp.name: page_number_alignment

AEq.caption: Start count on second page
AEq.doc: Check this box if you want the second page to be numerated with 1 and the remaining pages follow this order.
AEq.name: start_count_on_second_page

AEr.caption: Hide counter on
AEr.doc: Write here the page numbers you want the page count number not to show, like if you have a cover in the first page and want the number not to show, type 1. If you have several chapter covers (just an example) along your document and want them to not show the page count number, you may write the page numbers separated by comma, like this 1,3,5,10.
AEr.name: exclude_pages

AFC.caption: You can put elements in the footer by checking the box at the element itself that says "insert this element into footer?".
AFC.name: you_can_put_elements_in_the_footer_by_checking_the_box_at_the_element_itself_that_says_"insert_this_element_into_footer?".

AFJ.caption: Hide page number (counter) on specific pages?
AFJ.doc: Check this box if you want to specify below the pages you want the page number to not appear.
AFJ.name: use_exclude_pages

AFe.caption: Hide footer elements on specific pages?
AFe.doc: Check this box if you want to specify below the pages you want the elements (text, images and tables) you inserted into the footer to not appear.
AFe.name: use_exclude_elements_pages

AFf.caption: Hide elements on
AFf.doc: Write here the page numbers you want the footer elements (texts, images and tables) not to show, like if you have a cover in the first page and want the elements not to show there, type 1. If you have several chapter covers (just an example) along your document and want them to not show the footer elements, you may write the page numbers separated by comma, like this 1,3,5,10. Note that if you started counting on second page, the first page of the pdf will be number zero (0).
AFf.name: exclude_elements_pages

AOe.caption: Show total page count
AOe.doc: Change this to "yes" if you want to display something like "1/9" or "1 of 9" or even translated like "1 de 9" or any other symbol or word you specify in the field below.
AOe.name: show_total_page_count

AOf.caption: Counter divider
AOf.doc: This is what will stay between the current page count and total page count in case you marked the field above with "yes". You can write anything, for example if you want "1/9", you can just write a / here. If you want them to be spaced, like "1 / 9", then write a spacebar, /, then spacebar again. Same goes for words, write " of " with spaces if you want it to be "1 of 9", if you forget the spaces, it will be "1of9" in the PDF and I think this is not what you are interested in.
AOf.name: current_and_total_page_divider

AOu.caption: Counter style
AOu.doc: The text style to be applied to the footer counter.
AOu.name: number_style
